segment.documentation: BGM, Segment identifying the type of LEDGER message.
DTM, A segment containing the opening and closing dates of the accounting period of the accounting entries and the preparation date of the message.
RFF, Segment containing the number of the used chart of accounts linked to the message and its version number.
CUX, A segment providing currencies which are specific to the LEDGER message.
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for the purpose of providing additional clarification.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group giving information on sender, recipient and intermediary.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party.
RFF, A segment to provide references which are specific to the concerned party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify contacts and related communication numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide contacts related to the party.
COM, A segment to provide communication numbers of the contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to provide accounting, fiscal, social or legal characteristics of the accounting ledger.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a characteristic.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the characteristic. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments providing information on accounting entries by ledger.

segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment giving detailed information on the sequence of the ledger.

CPT, A segment containing detailed information identifying the active ledger account number (general, cost or budget account), or for evaluation, of the accounting record concerned or the subsidiary account number of this ledger account number.
FII, A segment for the purpose of specifying the bank account numbers relating to the specified account.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A segment group providing the following relevant information for a given period and a specified accounting ledger : record, account number, references, stated value, date and time, quantity and free text, together comprising an accounting record.

segment.documentation: IND, A segment containing the reference to an order number inside a folio, or the sequential number allocated to the entry of an accounting record for a given journal and period.
RFF, A segment containing the number of the source document relating to the accounting record.
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to give an explanation of the accounting entry.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: FII-CUX-MOA-SG7 A segment group containing all necessary information for an accounting record.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item of the accounting entries or records information sequence.
CPT, A segment containing detailed information identifying the account number (general, cost or budget account), or for evaluation of the accounting record concerned or the subsidiary account number.
RJL, A segment identifying the source document and the type of accounting records of accounting entries for a given period.
DTM, A segment giving the accountancy dates concerning the accounting record, date of capture, date of source document, date of accounting validation.
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to give a text for the entry describing whether the record is cost, budgetary or have valuation purposes.
PAI, A segment specifying the settlement method of the accounting record.

RFF, A segment containing references to documents such as the number of the source document, number of the related document, the internal source document reference and the checking reference and tax codes relating to the accounting record.
QTY, A segment for the purpose of specifying a quantity relating to the monetary amount of the accounting record.
TAX, A segment for specifying the duties, tax or fee types relating to the accounting record.
FII, A segment for the purpose of specifying the bank account numbers relating to the specified record.
CUX, A segment containing the currency details, currencies or currency rates used in the record.

MOA, A segment containing detailed information on the debit or credit trend of the monetary amount, the monetary amount itself in the local currency and possibly the currency code relating to this monetary amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to provide accounting, fiscal, social or legal characteristics of the accounting record.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a characteristic.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to provide authentication information.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment to provide authentication results.
DTM, A segment to provide the date of the authentication.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments providing information on the totals and the quantities corresponding to the accounting records for verification purposes, this group summarizes all the monetary amounts by account and by period.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment indicating the number of accounting entries for a ledger and period.
RFF, A segment to provide references related to a ledger or a period.
DTM, A segment containing the date related to a ledger or a period.

MOA, A segment adding up the total amounts of the accounting records for a ledger and period in local currency and in foreign currency. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
UNS, A service segment used to separate the detail and summary sections.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A segment group providing quantity and amount totals at message level.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment specifying the number of sub-periods included in the period covered by the message.
RFF, A segment providing references at message level.
DTM, A segment containing the date which are relevant at message level for verification purpose.
MOA, A segment adding up the total amounts relating to the LEDGER message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A segment group to provide authentication information.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment to provide authentication results.
DTM, A segment to provide the date of the authentication.
